titleStmt.title: Doha, Qatar National Library (مكتبة قطرالوطنية), HC.MS.03161

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

availability.p: Image credits: Qatar National Library, Heritage Library.

summary.p: 35 fol. (8th ḥizb, although it is called ǧuzʾ) on parchment; Shelfmark: HC.MS.03161; Qurʾānic Text: Q 3:171-4:23; Lines per page: 6 (fol. 2v and 34r: 4 lines); Dimensions:195 x 195 mm; Script style: Large Maġribī mabsūṭ, angular chrysography, Maġribī ṯuluṯ chrysography (colophons); Estimated date of production: First half of 14th century; Provenance: Northwest Africa (Maġrib) or Muslim Iberia (al-Andalus).

A lavish, multi-volume copy with richly illuminated frontispieces and finispieces. Yellow/orange dots mark the hamza above or below alif, and green dots signal alif al-waṣl. The symbols of sukūn and tašdīd are traced in blue, in contrast with all the other vocalisation marks, which are in red. The Maġribī ṯuluṯ chrysography employed in the colophons is strongly reminiscent of the epigraphy used in Marinid and Nasrid architectural decoration from the first half of the 14th century. The same can be said of the angular chrysography used for sūra titles, with its characteristically long and pointed terminations. Portions of this very manuscript are in:

HC.MS.03161 includes one ḥizb ("sixtieth part of the Qurʾān"). According to the classical segmentation of the text into 30th (ǧuzʾ) and 60th parts (ḥizb), this codex contains the text of ḥizb no. 8. The first and last pages text of the ḥizb are ornamented pages.
